newsitem.title: UK: UK shares slip from record levels after weaker Dow.
newsitem.headline: UK shares slip from record levels after weaker Dow.

text.p: UK shares failed to hold Monday's record levels at the opening as a late turnaround in prices on Wall Street put the London market under early pressure, traders said. But news of a special dividend payout from UK foods and household products group Reckitt & Coleman and of a merger of Cable & Wireless's UK operations with Nynex and Bell Cablemedia provided early bright spots.
Reckitt shares added 21-1/2p to 734-1/2p and Cable 19p to 460p, bucking early weakness in the FTSE 100 which slipped 4.7 points from Monday's record high to 4,068.4.
